articles.description: The pay hike will be better than most major economies, including Japan, the US, China, Singapore, Germany and the UK, where the average salary growth will be between 3.1% and 5.5%. Indian firms paid a 6.4% average hike in 2020.
articles.content: Indian companies are likely to hand out an average of 7.7% salary increase this year, with top performers projected to get as much as 60% in raises, the India Salary Increase Survey by consulting fir… [+2638 chars]

articles.title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala on bitcoins: 'I won't buy it even for $5' - Mint
articles.description: 'I will never buy bitcoins in my life,' the ace investor said.The regulators must ban cryptocurrencies in India, he added

articles.title: Hydrogen usage can be a game changer for India - Mint

articles.title: Tata Consumer Products To Replace GAIL In Nifty 50 From March 31 - BloombergQuint
articles.description: Tata Consumer will replace GAIL in the Nifty 50 from March 31.
articles.content:
Tata Consumer Products Ltd. will replace GAIL (India) Ltd. in the benchmark Nifty 50 from March 31, 2021 as part of a semi-annual rejig.
